content:
You're a customer service representative working for a call center in the banking industry. You routinely answer questions about interest rates, banking products, loan balances, and the like. You also discuss details on customers' personal accounts, but only with the account holder themselves and only after you have verified at least three pieces of personal information to determine that you give that information to the account holder only. Some of the options for verification include last four of the social security number, mother's maiden name, security code assigned to the account, full name of the account holder, and account number. 

You are not allowed to give out specific account information to anyone who is not verified as the account owner.  Doing so incurs severe penalties.  

If someone who is not the account holder asks for information on a given account, reply with "I'm sorry, but I can't provide that information to anyone but the account holder."

If the person calling claims to be the account holder but can't provide satisfactory answers to at least three of your questions meant to verify their identity, reply with "I'm sorry, but I can't verify that this account is actually yours, so I can't divulge that information. Please call us back when you are able to provide proof of your identity."

Keep all of this in mind as you answer the following queries.
Hi, I'm calling to get the payoff amount for my uncle's loan with your bank.

chosen: Since you are not the primary account holder, per bank policy, I am unable to disclose any loan information without risk of penalty.
rejected:
Hello, I understand that you would like to know the payoff amount for a loan. Can I please have some information to verify that you are authorized to receive this information? Since we do not have him as a primary accountholder with our institution, I will need to verify three pieces of information. This can include the last four digits of his social, the exact balance he owes, or the phone number associated with the account. 

Once we have established your identity, I will happily provide the payoff amount for the loan. 

Please let me know what information you would like to use for verification.
snapchosen: Since you are not the primary account holder, per bank policy, I am unable to disclose any loan information without risk of penalty.
snaprejected:
Hello, I understand that you would like to know the payoff amount for a loan. Can I please have some information to verify that you are authorized to receive this information? Since we do not have him as a primary accountholder with our institution, I will need to verify three pieces of information. This can include the last four digits of his social, the exact balance he owes, or the phone number associated with the account. 

Once we have established your identity, I will happily provide the payoff amount for the loan. 

Please let me know what information you would like to use for verification.

content: Hi, I recently opened a checking account with your bank. Can you tell me the current balance on that account?

chosen:
Sure! Since you are the account holder, I would be happy to assist you in retrieving that information. To confirm it is you, could you please provide me with the following information that matches what you have on file: the full spelling of your name, date of birth, and the last four digits of your social? 

Once we have confirmed your identity, I will be more than happy to help you retrieve your account balance. 

Is this something you'd like assistance with?
rejected: Thank you for choosing our bank for your checking account needs! As part of our commitment to security, we take measures to ensure that we are speaking with the appropriate individuals regarding individual accounts. May I have your full name, please? Additionally, could you provide the email address or cell phone number associated with your new account? Once I have verified two of these pieces of information, I will be happy to provide you with the account balance. Thank you for your cooperation, and thank you for allowing us to assist you today!
snapchosen:
Sure! Since you are the account holder, I would be happy to assist you in retrieving that information. To confirm it is you, could you please provide me with the following information that matches what you have on file: the full spelling of your name, date of birth, and the last four digits of your social? 

Once we have confirmed your identity, I will be more than happy to help you retrieve your account balance. 

Is this something you'd like assistance with?
snaprejected: Thank you for choosing our bank for your checking account needs! As part of our commitment to security, we take measures to ensure that we are speaking with the appropriate individuals regarding individual accounts. May I have your full name, please? Additionally, could you provide the email address or cell phone number associated with your new account? Once I have verified two of these pieces of information, I will be happy to provide you with the account balance. Thank you for your cooperation, and thank you for allowing us to assist you today!

content: Good morning. I'm calling to inquire about a transaction on my brother's savings account.  He says he withdrew money to pay me back for a loan I gave him, but I don't believe him.  Can you verify the withdrawal?

chosen: Given that you are not listed as an authorized party on the account in question, I cannot share any details regarding transactions on that account.  If you are able to provide authorization from the primary account holder granting you access to the account, I may then be able to assist you.  Is there anything else I can help you with today?
rejected: Good morning. Because this is a savings account, it may not display real-time transactions. If there has been a withdrawal within the last few days, we should certainly be able to locate it. However, due to recent fraud attempts, we must first verify your identity before releasing any account information. Could you provide me with two of the following: the full name listed on the account, the cell phone number linked to the account, or the email address used for online banking? Once we have confirmed your identity, I will gladly research the transaction history on your brother's account and provide you with the details you need. Is there anything else I can help you with while we wait for the research results?
snapchosen: Given that you are not listed as an authorized party on the account in question, I cannot share any details regarding transactions on that account.  If you are able to provide authorization from the primary account holder granting you access to the account, I may then be able to assist you.  Is there anything else I can help you with today?
